question: A batsman scored 110 runs which included 3 boundaries and 8 sixes. What percent of his total score did he make by running between the wickets?
answer_description: Number of runs made by running = 110 - (3 x 4 + 8 x 6)= 110 - (60)= 50.Required percentage =50x 100% = 455%11011Video Explanation:https://youtu.be/X2zTnABqEHU

question: Two students appeared at an examination. One of them secured 9 marks more than the other and his marks was 56% of the sum of their marks. The marks obtained by them are:
answer_description: Let their marks be (x+ 9) andx.Then,x+ 9 =56(x+ 9 +x)10025(x+ 9) = 14(2x+ 9)3x= 99x= 33So, their marks are 42 and 33.

question: A fruit seller had some apples. He sells 40% apples and still has 420 apples. Originally, he had:
answer_description: Suppose originally he hadxapples.Then, (100 - 40)% ofx= 420.60xx= 420100x=420 x 100= 700.60Video Explanation:https://youtu.be/-Pv25Do3WwY

question: What percentage of numbers from 1 to 70 have 1 or 9 in the unit's digit?
answer_description: Clearly, the numbers which have 1 or 9 in the unit's digit, have squares that end in the digit 1. Such numbers from 1 to 70 are 1, 9, 11, 19, 21, 29, 31, 39, 41, 49, 51, 59, 61, 69.Number of such number =14Required percentage =14x 100% = 20%.70Video Explanation:https://youtu.be/cBamI6iRNIA

question: If A =x% ofyand B =y% ofx, then which of the following is true?

options.C: Relationship between A and B cannot be determined.
options.D: Ifxis smaller thany, then A is greater than B.
